comments:
It would be helpful if the resource tree returned better error messages.  I got the following 
during a test of mine, and I don't have a clue what could be 
wrong.

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Problems 
encountered while deleting resources.
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.delete(Resource.java:460)
	... <snip> 
...

If it said the following, it would be a huge improvement in 
usability.

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Problems 
encountered while deleting resources, could not delete C:\foo\blah

The exception should contain a MultiStatus, and the status children should give
you a better indication of what happened.  Do you get a MultiStatus?

I got the stack trace from a JUnit test failure, so I would have to hack JUnit to look at the 
MultiStatus.  And, I can't debug this problem, because debugging it changes the timings of things 
and the problem goes away (hacking JUnit might also change the timing of things).

Is there any 
way to make the (plain-old-vanilla) stack dump more informative?

Is there any way you can log the exception?  The platform logger knows how to
"unwind" nested exceptions and statii and dump all the information to the log file.

What API method are you using?  If you're using IResource.delete we could
improve the MultiStatus message.  If you're using IWorkspace.delete then that's
the best we can do.

Marking invalid.  All the necessary information is included in the status, which
can be logged to obtain all the details.
